properties.name: Cobalt Lounge (RIP)
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44  32 NW 3rd Ave., Portland ORThis used to a be rock-type club that hosted a weekly "goth/industrial" dance night, which I never attended. I did however see FOETUS here one lovely evening, June 15, 2001. The club is now some sort of meat market sewer.

properties.name: Dead Can Dance, Paramount Theater, September 2005
properties.description: Posted by Wept  911 Pine Street, Seattle, WA, 98101I seem to be in the minority here, but for the steep ticket price (0+) I expected more. They had a lot of the backing music on DAT or synth, the performance seemed a bit lackluster and without passion. Perhaps I was expecting something different than what they were expecting to deliver, but I was definitely not as impressed as I had expected to be. It was a good show, don\'t get me wrong. But for 0+, and for the probably 00-300k they raked in for that night, we as an audience deserved more.

properties.name: Dunes
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44  1905 NE Martin Luther King Blvd., Portland, OR"secret" hole-in-the-wall hipster bar that hosts lots of HARSH NOISE shows.

properties.name: Favorite statue in Portland
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44 On Main St. between SW 3rd & 4th Avenues., Portland, ORThe "Thompson Elk Statue" (named after the 1879-1882 Portland mayor) located between the park blocks on Main Street and 3rd/4th Aves., facing the Federal Courthouse, Justice Center, Multnomah County Courthouse and Portland Building. I walk by this statue several times a week and hail it each time. The Elk is surrounded by the majestic ginko trees that grow in the adjacent parks.

properties.name: Foodhole
properties.description: Posted by Paiges16 nw 3rd portland orall ages venue with cheap rock shows. literally a gutted out restaurant with no amenities at all. the place sounds terrible but some of the cheapest best shows occur here. A sibling of Loveland.

properties.name: Gay Denny's
properties.description: Posted by Wept 5002 N. 7th St., Phoenix, AZWhat can be said about Gay Dennys? It\'s ubiquitous. Say "Gay Dennys" to just about anyone 15-35 years old in Phoenix and they will probably know what place you are talking about. As far as Denny\'ses(?!) go, this one is a definitely a must-go. The last time I went there they had changed the layout to the more "50s diner" though. :(

properties.name: Saw Pan(a)sonic at this club that no longer exists
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44 215 SE 9th, Portland, OROne of the most powerful shows I\'ve ever seen... the small room was totally obscured with smoke and fog. The sound of pure electricity shook the whole room. I was afraid the floor would collapse through.

properties.name: Wynn's Hot Dogs
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44 SW 4th and Morrison St., Portland, ORAwesome hot dog cart downtown. The King Dog and the Weenie Queen are one of the nicest couples in town!
